The general spectra, indicating the presence on the surface of Si, C, and O, are depicted in Figure 2. The C 1s, O 1s, and Si 2p high-resolution XPS spectra are presented in Figure 3. No significant changes in the O 1s and Si 2p spectra can be noticed, irrespective of the synthesis method. In contrast, the high-resolution C 1s peak can be fitted with several components, which depend on the preparation conditions. Thus, the components associated with C sp 2 (284.6 eV), sp 3 (285.5 eV), -C-OH (286.5 eV), O-C=O (288.8 eV), and -CO 2 adventitious species (290.7 eV) were identified according with the literature data [ 36, 37, 38], as depicted in Table 1. The content in oxygenated carbon is low, in comparison with the C sp 2 and sp 3 which remain the main components (70%), denoting a good graphitization method.
